definition: soldiers munity and troops rebel (idiom); turmoil and chaos of war
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Miss, is a man of war.
sentences.chinese: 思念，是一個人的兵荒馬亂。

sentences.english: Bohr, my childhood in Munich came to an end in anarchy and civil war.
sentences.chinese: 波爾，我的童年是在慕尼黑兵荒馬亂的內戰中終結的。

sentences.english: Is being idle in the chaos of war?
sentences.chinese: 是於兵荒馬亂中的閒散自淫？

sentences.english: Then after the war have flowers blooming like a piece of brocade.
sentences.chinese: 於是餘有繁花似錦後的兵荒馬亂。

sentences.english: I Beihuanchige is your earth-shaking sadness.
sentences.chinese: 你們的悲歡離合是我兵荒馬亂的悲傷。

definition: fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
